reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I read the reviews prior, I couldn’t help but wonder how the same resort could get such drastically different reviews. I looked for the reasons during my stay there in August. I was traveling with another couple and we are in our 30s. This is not the first time to the area but the first time at this resort. I am a 4/5 star resort kind of girl but I have also come to realize a 4-star in the states is not quite the same as a 4-star in Mexico. I apologize in advance for the length – I tried to include everything in the review!
reviews.title: An Honest Review - Lovely Hotel!

reviews.text: FACILITY
reviews.title: Good overall, but watch the food...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is large – if large is not your thing, this is not a place for you. As already commented on by many, the grounds are well kept and the various buildings are spread out. Where your building can make a huge difference! Buildings 1-10 are centrally located but they surround the loud and rowdy pool. If you like that, it’s a great location. If you don’t, steer clear of it. We stayed in building 21 and it was one of the closest buildings to the Select beach area. The section of rooms in buildings 20-25 are great if you want to be a quick walk to the beach. Because of where they are located, your balconies are very secluded and some of the rooms have partial ocean views. In terms of the Select Club rooms in buildings 70 and up, as was already mentioned by a writer, I would agree that it is a scam to get you to stay there by making you feel special. The rooms are farthest from everything, especially the beach. The plus side: they are the newer rooms and are more updated. If updated is more important than being close to the beach, it might be a good fit for you.
reviews.title: OMG Some people are never happy

likes.liked: — select club beach house and pool area

reviews.text: ROOMS
reviews.title: Nice, but not as good as it used to be

reviews.text: We were upgraded to the Select Club. My room was 2121 which was a Jr. Suite. It had a oceanview and was very secluded. The rooms were a little dated, in need of a little TLC but the space of the rooms made up for that for me. The room had a Jacuzzi on the balcony and it was very private. Marble bathrooms, large (and yes, hard) bed and a nice living room. I was pleased with the space. A note: the Jacuzzi water is hard water and leaves a rusty residue on clothing. Nothing wrong with the water but worth noting. Keep that in mind if you intend to use it with a bathing suit!
reviews.title: best hloliday ever! the jones family ,Barnsley UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, I have to admit that I booked this resort before I was told about this site, and was extremely worried. Worried because it was my honeymoon and so many people had wrote such bad things about this place.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So throughout my 1 week stay, my wife and I wondered who the people were that wrote so negatively about this place.
reviews.title: Still itching...

reviews.text: -STAFF-
reviews.title: Good Relaxing Vacation

likes.liked: — Size of the room and cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Loud boisterous behaviour and smoking in the pool

reviews.text: Great. Very friendly and very hard working. Seems like there is always someone cleaning, working, and available to help with whatever your needs.
reviews.title: Great holiday don't know what people were complaining about

likes.liked: — There was always something to do
likes.disliked: — That some of the restaurants were air conditioned

reviews.text: -ROOMS-
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: Four of us really enjoyed our stay at this four **** resort. People (staff) are wonderful and food are excellent. Resort is clean and the combination of ocean and jungle setting is great. Been to Cuba twice but this one is exceptional.
reviews.title: Plus, plus and plus.

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week stay at the Sandos Caracol. We were there July 19th-26th and I have to say I was very pleased. I was a bit apprehensive after reading mixed reviews but that just goes to show you how opinions/expectations differ from person to person. I brought my two 18 year old boys as a graduation trip. It was their first time to Mexico.
reviews.title: Great Time at the Caracol

likes.liked: — The entertainment staff was awesome and got the teens involved in activities. The grounds were also well manicured and beautiful
likes.disliked: — Although the room was neat and clean it was pretty plain.

reviews.text: Our first day/travel day started out a bit rocky. We had some airplane problems which delayed us a couple hours. This apparently got us into the Cancun airport around the same time as several other planes. The airport was a nightmare. We spent over 2.5 hours in lines at the airport. They did little to alleviate the problem. I thought possibly they would add more agents but this is Mexico so they didnt. It was painfully slow but we eventually got through. Because we were so late we had difficulty finding our luggage and there werent many employees that spoke English so this added to our frustration. After about 3 hours we were out of the airport and on our way to the Caracol. Check in was a breeze, probably because we were so late. We were shuttled to our room We stayed in a Double Standard that was back in the jungle somewhat behind the Lobby, Room 3501. The room was nothing to write home about. It was small but clean and the air conditioning worked great. The mini bar was stocked with soda, water and beer. Good start. The first couple of days it drizzled on and off and one evening we were all asked to return to our rooms and stay there from 10 pm til dawn due to tropical storm Dolly that was milling around off the coast. Eventually the weather cleared and our last 5 days were spectacular. Clear and sunny.
reviews.title: Good times at Sandos

likes.disliked: — Things that can't be helped-the hot humid weather, mosquitos, rough ocean floor

reviews.text: The resort grounds were beautiful. Very well manicured. Al though things were spread out throughout the resort I enjoyed the walks through the grounds. We were about 5 minutes from the beach. I never had a problem finding somewhere to pull up a chair and put down my stuff either at the beach or the pool. The beach was a bit rocky but when the weather cleared so did the water so it was easier to walk out into the water because you could see the rocks. There is some kind of "eco tube" that goes around the beach supposedly to keep it cleaner. I thought this tube was kind of an eye sore and took away from the view. A lot of kids and adults crawled and stood on this tube and jumped into waves. A word of caution. These get slippery and they are kind of like a burlap material where you can get scraped up. On the other side of this tube there was some snorkeling available. You could see the standard variety of fish you see at all Carribean Resorts nothing out of the ordinary. No coral or reefs within swimming distance. We never had a problem checking out snorkeling equipment, the same was true with Kayaks and boards etc.
reviews.title: OK, Except For the Main Pool

likes.liked: — Large room, comfortable beds, cold air conditioning
likes.disliked: — Main pool was dangerous, terrible wine, not the most attractive beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We all enjoyed the beach side pool. They had a great entertainment staff that planned and organized many beach/poolside activities. These people were great and worked many long days. It amazed me how quickly they learned your name and put things on a personal basis. We all really enjoyed the beach volleyball games.
reviews.title: Best Time of Our Lives!!!!

likes.liked: — Beach, food & drinks, fun activities, beautiful scenery
likes.disliked: — It might be a challenge for older people or those who can't walk well because of the size of the resort, but I'm sure you can request a room on ground floor close to the beach & food, and guests can call bellboys to drive them to their destination.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was alarmed by some of the reviews before my husband and i went on our trip. After experiencing the Sandos myself it's hard to believe that these bad reviews were based on the same hotel. This is an honest review. I have been to Mexico before but stayed at EDSS which is a five star and amazing but we did pay a lot of money. For the Sandos we paid much less, here is an honest review.
reviews.title: great family resort

likes.liked: — Quality of food and the beach.

reviews.text: ROOM:
reviews.title: lovely setting

reviews.text: We got upgraded to a select room by signing up for the Sandos 4u. The room was big very clean, mini bar stocked. The shower was huge plenty of hot water enough to fill the giant tub. We were given fresh towels every day no complaints.
reviews.title: Loved Sandos Caracol!

likes.disliked: — Havent really got any complaints to be honest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD:
reviews.title: the worse vacation ever

reviews.text: The food was good the Italian and main buffet were nice with plenty of selection, you just have to try different foods such as the fish and meat. The Mexican wasn't good the food was bland. This was ashame as we love Mexican food and thought this would be the best buffet as we are in Mexico.
reviews.title: It may sound like Sandals,but its NOT!!

likes.liked: — The tours away from the resort
likes.disliked: — Contracted staff at the photo shop, snorkle shop, towell shack. MGMT.
